scenarioDescription:
The HD 124330 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 124330 is a star with 1.15 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.3 times its radius. It is located 196.34 light years away from the solar system.

HD 124330 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 124330 system


HD 124330 b

HD 124330 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2021-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.86 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 124330 b is 238.500 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 124330 b is 14.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 124330 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 124330, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HD 124330 - System With 1 Exoplanet
